w:r.w:t: Here you can learn about
me, my
education,
and my
work experience
Over the years I have been lucky enough to attend a wide variety of academic institutions.
During my childhood I was enrolled in
Stoneybrooke
Christian Schools a small school located in
Ladara
Ranch, California. Later, I attended Sage Hill School, a newly formed private school in Newport Beach, where I had the opportunity
to learn and grow with the school
For my freshman year of college I moved Washington DC where I attended George Washington University
Living in DC was an incredible experience, however due to family circumstances I had to move back to Californian and thus I transferred to USC.
Sage Hill School and
Stoneybrooke
Christian Schools were both essential
parts of my educational
Stoneybrooke
instill in me the work tireless work ethic that has enabled me to be so successful thus far, while Sage Hill undeniably
Studying at George Washington was an incredible experience
The dorm I lived in was across the street from the World Bank, one block away from the International Monetary Fund, and three blocks away from the White House.
I had such an incredible experience there, that I had to go back, and the summer following my sophomore year I participated in a program that enabled me to study and work in Washington again.
Currently I am at USC, and I could not be happier. USC has provided me with a vast number of
opportunities
and
has been essential in helping me get to where I am today.

The Duel Degree program of the school has allowed me to take more classes and earn more degrees that I could have possibly gained elsewhere, while the Trojan network has proven to be an incredible asset in aiding me finding internships and further my professional goals.
